data.title: slimplectic: Discrete non-conservative numerical integrator
data.name: slimplectic
data.description: Python code for generating and running "slimplectic" integrators (nonconservative variational integrators)

evidence: "slimplectic is a python implementation of the discrete non-conservative numerical integrator of Tsang, Galley, Stein, and Turner (2015)" (research-focused numerical integrator implementation).

The README points to example notebooks such as "Damped_Oscillator_SlimplecticGGLvsRK.ipynb" and "PostNewtonian_Inspiral_with_RK.ipynb", indicating it is run as an application to perform simulations/analyses.
The repository README provides no installation commands via package managers or binaries, only links to notebooks and screenshots, implying use directly from the source repository.
